seo.content:
Look Traditionally Dapper in Kurtas


There’s an explainable appeal of men in traditional wear. With slicked-back hair, crisp kurtas, dhotis, veshtis, Kolhapuris, and more, they look regal and majestic. It’s a refreshing change to see men pay respect to their culture and dress up accordingly for various occasions. In schools and colleges, guys dress up in kurtas and other traditional wear for occasions such as ‘ethnic day’, ‘parents’ day’, ‘annual day’, and so on. These outfits remind young men of their roots and their heritage and also help them understand the diversity of our country. 

Even though all of us stay in different regions of the country, we are bound together by our sense of patriotism that is especially showcased during such occasions. Corporate offices also instill a deep sense of pride in our country by arranging occasions that require us to dress up in ethnic wear. And, since most offices expect men to dress up in formal Western wear, coming to work in kurtas, veshtis, and dhotis is a welcomed change. You can see men and women having a blast taking pictures, dancing, and eating during such occasions. 

Today, fashion designers and brand houses are coming up with new and improved styles of kurtas and other traditional wear to make sure that each individual can find a style that matches their own. That is why it's beneficial to know about the different ways you can style your traditional outfits so that you can stand out in a crowd. 

Now, let’s discuss some of the styles that you can try out to create fashionable looks for different occasions. 


Different Ways That You Can Rock Kurtas 


With these traditional outfits, it doesn’t matter what body type you fall into as they suit almost all body types. So, you can turn up at your friend’s sangeet, a political rally in your college, or a Diwali puja in your favourite kurta. But, there are a few different ways you can elevate your look. And, since fashion isn’t set in stone, it makes sense for you to push your fashion boundaries, reach out of your comfort zone, and try out styles you wouldn’t have dared to try in the past.

 

For example, you can choose to wear sneakers with your outfit instead of traditional footwear, or you can wear a trench coat over your kurta. 


Trench Coats 

When you look at a trench coat, you can’t help but wonder if its design was inspired by kurtas. These coats perfectly complement these traditional outfits, especially during the winter. This way, you can stay stylish and warm during early morning wedding ceremonies, pujas, and so on. An additional style tip would be to stick to pairing this look with slim jeans to give you a taller appearance. 


Rugged Leather Jackets 

Another trendy look that you can try out is pairing drape style kurtas with leather jackets . You can look much more masculine and rugged during Diwali parties, wedding receptions, dinner parties, pujas, and so on. This is another look that you can try out during cooler climatic conditions. 


Stitched-in Shawls 

Instead of sticking to the usual bandhgalas and sherwani for the next big occasion, you can choose to wear kurtas that feature stitched-in shawls. This elegant look will leave people admiring you all through the event. You can pair this look with appropriate footwear and you’re good to go. Just be prepared to answer endless questions about where you got a hold of the outfit. 


And, in case you don’t find outfits with stitched-in shawls, you can skim through magazines and the Internet to get hold of the most suitable example and visit a local tailor (along with the cloth material). This way, you can get the perfect outfit tailored to your liking. 


Monotone Look 

You can turn up to a party in an all-black (white or grey) ensemble. Along with a black kurta and black bottoms, you can complete the look with a dapper-looking black blazer. Style your hair and spritz yourself with your favourite perfume and watch how the crowd looks at you in awe. 


Draw Inspiration from the Past

Many designers, celebrities, stylists, and fashion houses look back in time and bring back a variety of styles that become big hits in the fashion industry. Thus, it’ll be incredibly helpful for you to look back at your old family pictures and look for fashionable looks that you can bring back. (Don’t underestimate the fashion choices of your parents, grandparents, and great-grandparents, they wear quite fashionable back in the day!) 

This way, you not only get to create new looks, but you also get to pay respect to your family’s legacy. 


Fusions 

You can combine formal and casual themes by pairing your kurta with skinny jeans . This look perfectly captures the nature of the youth of today. This look screams modern with a dash of tradition. And, it showcases that no matter how Western you may seem, you’ve not forgotten your cultural past. 


Shop for Kurtas Online 


The best way for you to get your hands on the latest traditional wear is by shopping online. This way, you can sit in the comfort of your home and shop for brands such as Peter England, British Club, Svanik, and many more. You can also find outfits that cater to different occasions such as casual wear, festive and party wear, formal wear, wedding wear, and so on. 

Most shopping sites also include carefully crafted size charts that you can refer before you make your purchasing decision. The shopping sites may also include product descriptions, customer reviews, images, specifications that can help you make an informed purchasing decision. 

While shopping online, it’s useful to use keywords such as ‘kurta for men’, ‘buy kurta for men’, ‘men’s kurta online’, etc., into the search bars of shopping sites and search engines to enable them to pull up the most relevant results. Online shopping enables you to save yourself the trouble of going out to shop for something that you can easily buy online. And, once you choose to buy kurtas online, you can get them delivered to your very doorstep! How convenient is that? Happy shopping!
